definition: word/statement/speech/lyrics/CL:組|组[zu3],個|个[ge4]/a form of lyric poetry, flourishing in the Song dynasty 宋朝|宋朝[Song4 chao2]/CL:首[shou3]

sentences.english: The title of the work was a word of onomatopoeia, read interesting.
sentences.chinese: 作品的题目是个象声词，读起来就很有意思。

sentences.english: Mimetic word has its special glamour in Chinese vocabulary.
sentences.chinese: 象声词是汉语词库中独具魅力的一类词。

sentences.english: Children are very interested in words the sound object .
sentences.chinese: 孩子对象声词很感兴趣。

sentences.english: Onomatopoeia comes from phonetic sounds which simulate those of nature.
sentences.chinese: 象声词是用语音模拟自然声音形成的词。

sentences.english: This regularity is also to be found in four-syllabled onomatopoeic words.
sentences.chinese: 此规律也适用于由四个不同的音节所构成的象声词。

sentences.english: Onomatopoeia is a kind of language phenomenon which is universal as well as very important.
sentences.chinese: 象声词是一种语言现象是一种普遍的，也很重要。

sentences.english: No, they weren't composed entirely of onomatopoeias meant to represent the sound of explosions.
sentences.chinese: 这些书也不全是由代表爆炸的象声词所构成。

definition: the four tones of Middle Chinese: level tone 平聲|平声, rising tone 上聲|上声, departing tone 去聲|去声 and entering tone 入聲|入声/the four tones of Modern Standard Mandarin
character with two or more readings
